verses.roman:
eka adbhuta--sama-kāle doṅhāra prakāśa
āra adbhuta--citta-guhāra tamaḥ kare nāśa

synonyms: eka—one; adbhuta—wonderful thing; sama-kāle—at the same time; doṅhāra—of both; prakāśa—the manifestation; āra—the other; adbhuta—wonderful thing; citta-guhāra—of the core of the heart; tamaḥ—darkness; kare—do; nāśa—destruction.
translation: The first wonder is that both brothers appear simultaneously, and the other is that They illuminate the innermost depths of the heart.
